column1: Cottage Grove  is a city 10 miles (16 km) south of Saint Paul in Washington County in the State of Minnesota. It lies on the north bank of the Mississippi River
column2: north of the confluence with the St. Croix River. Cottage Grove and nearby suburbs form the southeast portion of Minneapolis-Saint Paul
column3: the 16th-largest metropolitan area in the United States
column4: with about 3.52 million residents. Its population was 34
column5: 589 at the 2010 census.The city is linked by U.S. Highways 10 and 61 and has a comfortable commute to both downtowns and the I-494 Strip in Bloomington. Once a rural township known for the state's first creameries and wheat production
column6: the area was served by rail lines
column8: and grist mills. 3M has operated a production facility in Cottage Grove since 1947.

column1: Cottage Grove was platted in 1871.  The Precolumbian Schilling Archeological District
column4: and 1917 Cordenio Severance House are listed on the National Register of Historic Places.

column1: Cottage Grove is five miles southeast of St. Paul.  It is accessed by U.S. Highway 61 and Interstate 494.
According to the United States Census Bureau
column2: the city has a total area of 37.48 square miles (97.07 km2); 33.62 square miles (87.08 km2) is land and 3.86 square miles (10.00 km2) is water.The city has more land adjacent to the Mississippi River than any other city in Minnesota. It is bordered by Woodbury to the north
column4: St. Paul Park to the west
column6: and Denmark Township to the east. The city is approximately half an hour at posted speeds from the Minneapolis-St. Paul International Airport. Southeastern Cottage Grove is five miles from the Wisconsin border.

column1: 3M has operated a production facility in Cottage Grove since 1947 to manufacture adhesive products
column4: and for research and development. PFC production began as a pilot around 1947; full-scale commercial PFOA production began in 1976 and was phased out in 2002. The site is part of the Minnesota Pollution Control Agency Superfund program for perfluorochemical contamination.

column1: Cottage Grove's annual Strawberry Fest draws thousands of residents together to celebrate. This event is held at Kingston Park
column2: usually in the second week of June. A parade occurs the Saturday of the festival
column3: in which organizations or businesses can have a float
column5: and advertise. On the Saturday of the festival
column7: organizations and businesses advertise in booths at the soccer fields at Kingston Park. They hand out free things and talk to the residents of Cottage Grove about their businesses. There are fireworks on the Saturday of the festival around 10 pm. There are many carnival games
column9: and food. Every night of the festival except Sunday
column10: bands play in the Kingston parking lot. Alcohol is allowed but only in a designated area.

column1: === Museums and other points of interest ===

column5: Old People's Home of the Northwest Cemetery

column1: Cottage Grove is home to Ravine Regional Park
column2: with the entrance off of Keats Ave S. It is open daily from 6 A.M. to 10 P.M. The park has 515 acres of woods
column5: creating a unique habitat for an assortment of species. A vehicle permit is required to enter the park grounds.

column2: Cottage Grove opened a splash pad at Highland Park off of 70th street. This is a smaller water attraction intended for small children. It has many sprinklers that shoot water. Several other splash pads in the Cottage Grove area are expected to open at other parks.

column1: Cottage Grove has an 18-hole disc golf course in Oak Wood park
column2: near its retail area. The course has a variety of different length holes and women's tees.

column1: Cottage Grove had one of the two remaining drive-in theaters in operation in the Twin Cities area
column2: the Cottage View Drive-In. It was near the Innovation Road exit of Highway 61. It closed after the 2012 season and was torn down. The land is now occupied by a Wal-Mart that opened in 2014.

column1: Cottage Grove is in Minnesota's 2nd congressional district
column2: represented by Angie Craig. Its public buildings include City Hall
column5: a public works building and an 18-hole championship golf course
column6: River Oaks. Washington County also has two buildings in town
column7: the library and the South Washington County Service Center.

column1: Cottage Grove is part of the South Washington County School District. High School students living in Cottage Grove usually attend either Park High School or East Ridge High School. Cottage Grove also has the school district's Alternative Learning Center (ALC). Middle School students living in Cottage Grove usually attend either Cottage Grove Middle School or Oltman Middle School. Elementary School students usually attend one of the six elementary schools in the city: Armstrong Elementary
Mainlines to Chicago of both the Canadian Pacific Railway and BNSF pass through Cottage Grove between US 61 and the Mississippi River.
